intro: Hedyotis coronaria, commonly known as the goldenstar, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Hedyotis coronaria is often found in open forests and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils.
